ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot more about Chinese culture and vocabulary.
I gained more knowledge into Chinese culture and improved my Chinese vocabulary and grammar.

As a heritage student, I was really able to refresh my Chinese knowledge and regain a deep understanding of my culture. It was a great course and professor Wang was truly an incredibly caring and dedicated teacher.

This course helped me refresh my Chinese language knowledge after not visiting China for many years. I also learned a lot of more sophisticated/advanced vocab, and greatly strengthened my writing ability.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: The teacher, the community of the class
Weaknesses: The content was a bit boring at times

The class is a pretty small seminar so you get to meet other Chinese-heritage students.

Wang laoshi is super kind, and class is pretty open-ended and discussion based.
This course offers a lot of peer collaboration, I made a lot of friends. This course can be improved perhaps with more test opportunities.

The course was designed to have a workload necessary to help us actually improve our language abilities but to not be a major burden on our time. Class itself was really engaging and energetic, definitely one of my most interesting courses.
This course did not have many weaknesses, everything we did from homeworks to projects to the mini tests at the beginning of each class were reasonable and helpful.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would! The class is quite low-stress and the teacher is super supportative. Many people find a group of close friends through their Chinese class and this was definitely true for me. The content of the class is what it is, but, particularly for this class, there is a lot of valuable learning done outside of the textbook. This class was probably the class that was most engaging for me this semester and is probably one of the few I will actually miss.
Yes 100%, especially with Wang laoshi! You get to learn much much more about your heritage, and I feel like it has allowed me to connect with my family on a deeper level.
Yes I would recommend this course to students who want to engage with more Chinese culture and make friends.
Absolutely, a great way to find a community of like minded individuals and reinvigorate your knowledge of Chinese culture and language.
Yes! besides all the academic benefits, the smaller size of the class makes it a tighter knit group where everyone knows each other and there is a strong sense of community.
